intro: Gelasia longiana, commonly known as the longleaf gelasia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
